page.title: 08ENERGY
page.content: The Hydro-Board is the largest single local employer including fourteen engineers working on a shift/standby system. There is an exhibition explaining the function of the dam employing three people. Pitlochry power station and dam was completed in 1950, with a length of 486 yards including the cut-off wall. It generates about 54 million units of electricity a year from water flowing off a catchment area of 706 square miles . The water flows at a rate of 16 m.p.h. through the two Kaplan turbines turning the blades which drive two 7,000 kw generators. When operated at full capacity about 1.5 million gallons of water passes through them each minute. There is a 35 step fish ladder which so far this year has been used by 431 fish, a marked decline on past years.
